text: That a thai character has a name is somewhat of a lie. There is no name other than the character itself.

What we mean with giving a character a name is simply associating the character with a word so that we know which character we are talking about. Much like we do in english when we say “M as in Monkey”.
Let’s look at a few examples. Both thai and english.

ก ไก่ - go gai - c, chicken
ม ม้า - mo maa - h, horse
This is extra important in thai because there are multiple characters that sound exactly the same.

ผ ผึ้ง - pho pheung - b, bee
พ พาน - pho phan - t, tray
ภ สำเภา - pho sam-phao - s, sailboat
Now you might wonder why there are characters that sound the same. The short answer is for historical reasons.
